name: Burger King
text: Burger king surprises me with their veggie patty and their grilled chicken sandwich selections, because unlike many other fast food locations, they're actually really good.  My only gripe, which is in no way exclusive to Burger king, is they left mayo on my sandwich when I asked for none.  Otherwise, decent sandwich, and it's close enough where i'll make my way in its doors some other time.
lemma: Burger king surprise veggie patty grilled chicken sandwich selection unlike many fast food location actually really good gripe way exclusive Burger king leave mayo sandwich ask none Otherwise decent sandwich close enough make way door time

name: Burger King
text:
This Burger King should be shut down. I have been stupidly coming here every few months or so for about 5 years. They change employees so often here, there is a brand new staff every few months. The constant change of staff puts false hope in my mind that the food will improve. It never does.

The food here is always dry. BK recipes call for a certain amount of condiments to be used in each sandwich. This particular location is notorious for using a lot less than the recipe calls for with mayo and sauces. This leaves any chicken sandwiches and burgers extra dry and nearly inedible.

When it comes to getting an order placed correctly, this location fails in this seemingly simple task. For example, if I order 6 things, there will always be either 1 missing from the receipt, the receipt will be correct but the wrong item in the bag, or something just plain missing from the bag.

There is really no good aspect to this particular BK location. Stay away. It is the worst in the state. Why I keep coming here on occasion is beyond me.
lemma: Burger King shut stupidly come every month year change employee often brand new staff every month constant change staff put false hope mind food improve never food always dry BK recipe call certain amount condiment use sandwich particular location notorious use lot less recipe call mayo sauce leave chicken sandwich burger extra dry nearly inedible come get order place correctly location fail seemingly simple task example order thing always either miss receipt receipt correct wrong item bag something plain miss bag really good aspect particular BK location Stay away bad state keep come occasion beyond

name: Burger King
text: We stopped in this evening about 7:50 and ordered, dinner, a whopper, onion rings, Chicken sandwich and two burritos, chicken sandwich was dry and had old lettuce that was well past time to throw out, the two tacos were so oily and just nasty, shells were in pieces and dripped of oil, don't feel we will be back, period!
lemma: stop evening order dinner whopper onion ring Chicken sandwich two burrito chicken sandwich dry old lettuce well past time throw two taco oily nasty shell piece dripped oil feel back period

name: Burger King
text:
I just (December 4th, 2010 at 1:50PM) went through the Burger King drive-through at store #12114 (9400 SE 82ND Ave in Portland, OR 97266).  I was giving my order and was repeatedly asked to speak louder, after giving part of my order I had mentioned that the order was wrong and that it was supposed to be 2 of one item and not of the other. Upon attempting to fix my order the employee told me to "shut the hell up" then after saying I wanted to speak to a manager I was told to "get the hell out of here".

I went into the store and demanded to talk to a supervisor that I assume was getting off as she said I could wait around for the other manager to take a report.  The person that my receipt (order 207) says took my order (that was the manager that I talked with) is 7017, Hunter S.

This is extremely unsatisfactory service; I've been frequenting your restaurants in the greater Portland area all of my life, and to be treated like this by someone who doesn't have any customer relations skills is completely ludicrous.

My order was an extremely simple one:
-Kids Meal
--Chicken Nuggets
--Apple Fries
--White Milk

-#2 - Double Whopper Meal
--King Sized
--Coke

-12 Piece Chicken Fries
-2 Chicken Sandwiches

A trained monkey could have taken my order.
lemma: December th PM go Burger King drive store SE ND Ave Portland give order repeatedly ask speak louder give part order mention order wrong suppose one item Upon attempt fix order employee tell shut hell say want speak manager tell get hell go store demand talk supervisor assume get say could wait around manager take report person receipt order say take order manager talk Hunter extremely unsatisfactory service frequent restaurant great Portland area life treat like someone customer relation skill completely ludicrous order extremely simple one Kids Meal Chicken Nuggets Apple Fries White Milk Double Whopper Meal King Sized Coke Piece Chicken Fries Chicken Sandwiches trained monkey could take order

name: Burger King
text: Do not be fooled by the commercials for the chicken parmesan sandwich!  This is by far the worst chicken sandwich I have ever eaten!  I wish I could get my money back, or at least have my stomach pumped!!  Everything was cold, nothing tasted fresh on the sandwich and it was served on a very plain bun!  I will never make the same mistake again.
lemma: fool commercial chicken parmesan sandwich far bad chicken sandwich ever eat wish could get money back least stomach pump Everything cold nothing taste fresh sandwich serve plain bun never make mistake

name: Burger King
text:
The strangest experience ever!
We pulled up to the drive through. 
Inside was closed. 
Sat there for about ten minutes. The girl started with our order. 
Stopped due to an argument between coworkers. 
Took her ten more minutes to get back to us. 
But we could hear the argument. 
No chicken sandwiches. 
Had to ask for my credit back. She put it down we had to ask for it back. 
They had everyone pay then pull around to the front door. Waited twenty minutes.  Total of seven cars @ 11:45 pm July 4, 2019
Girl from drive through would unlock the front door, wave to who's order and that person had to meet her at the front door. 
Fries were hot, three whopper jrs cold! 
So so so odd. 
We will drive further to go to another location.
lemma: strange experience ever pull drive Inside close Sat ten minute girl start order Stopped due argument coworkers Took ten minute get back us could hear argument chicken sandwich ask credit back put ask back everyone pay pull around front door Waited twenty minute Total seven car pm July Girl drive would unlock front door wave order person meet front door Fries hot three whopper jr cold odd drive go another location

name: Burger King
text:
I occasionally indulge in fast food.  One of my longtime favorites from my childhood was the chicken sandwich at Burger King.  Don't ask me why.

But recently they offered up a 2 for 1 on the 'Original' chicken sandwich.  I got home late from a business trip and nothing else was open so I came here.

This is NOT the original chicken sandwich.  In fact it wasn't even the chicken sandwich in the picture.  THe bread was changed to a ciabatta bread that was dry and stale.  The sandwich was smaller.  I was very disappointed.

I can't say I won't ever eat at a BK.  Sometimes you're places where there is nothing else...like say IN an airport.  But I find this just as disappointing as when McDonald changed their apple pie.
lemma: occasionally indulge fast food One longtime favorite childhood chicken sandwich Burger King ask recently offer Original chicken sandwich get home late business trip nothing else open come original chicken sandwich fact even chicken sandwich picture bread change ciabatta bread dry stale sandwich small disappointed say ever eat BK Sometimes place nothing else like say airport find disappointing McDonald change apple pie
